name: Amazon Lambda
description: The AmazonLambda Connector allows you to access the REST API of Amazon Web Service Lambda (AWS Lambda) , which lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. With Lambda, you can run code for virtually any type of application or backend service - all with zero administration. Just upload your code in one of the languages that AWS Lambda supports (currently Node.js, Java, C#, Go and Python) and Lambda takes care of everything required to run and scale your code with high availability.

params.name: layerName
params.description: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the layer. For example: my-layer or arn:aws:lambda:us-east-1:123456789012:layer:my-layer

params.name: layerVersionNumber
params.description: The version number of the layer from which to remove the permission

params.name: layerStatementId
params.description: The identifier that was specified when the statement was added. This must match exactly the statement ID used when the permission was originally granted

params.name: layerRevisionId
params.description: Only update the policy if the revision ID matches the ID that's specified. Use this to ensure that the policy hasn't changed since you last read it

params.name: apiVersionRemoveLayerVersionPermission
params.description: API version used for RemoveLayerVersionPermission method

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: The name of the variable to store the response. If not specified, the response will be stored in the message body

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Whether to replace the message body with the response from this operation

params.name: functionName
params.description: The name of the Lambda function to be deleted

params.name: apiVersionDeleteFunction
params.description: API version for DeleteFunction method

params.name: deleteFunctionQualifier
params.description: Specify a version to delete. You can't delete a version that's referenced by an alias

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: functionName
params.description: The name of the Lambda function

params.name: apiVersionInvoke
params.description: API version for Invoke method

params.name: qualifier
params.description: Specify a version or alias to invoke a published version of the function

params.name: x-amz-invocation-type
params.description: Invocation type: RequestResponse (synchronous), Event (asynchronous), or DryRun (validation only) Supported values: RequestResponse, Event, DryRun

params.name: x-amz-log-type
params.description: Set to Tail to include the execution log in the response Supported values: None, Tail

params.name: x-amz-client-context
params.description: Up to 3583 bytes of base64-encoded data about the invoking client to pass to the function in the context object

params.name: payload
params.description: The JSON that you want to provide to your Lambda function as input

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: functionName
params.description: The name of the Lambda function

params.name: apiVersionGetFunction
params.description: API version for GetFunction method

params.name: qualifier
params.description: Specify a version or alias to get information about a specific version

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: functionName
params.description: Name of the Lambda function, version, or alias to which add a new permission

params.name: apiVersionAddPermission
params.description: API version for AddPermission method

params.name: permissionQualifier
params.description: Specify a version or alias to apply the permission to the specified function version

params.name: permissionAction
params.description: The AWS Lambda action to allow (e.g., lambda:InvokeFunction or lambda:GetFunction)

params.name: permissionStatementId
params.description: A unique statement identifier that differentiates the statement from others in the same policy

params.name: permissionPrincipal
params.description: The AWS service or account that invokes the function (e.g., s3.amazonaws.com)

params.name: eventSourceToken
params.description: A unique token supplied by the principal invoking the function

params.name: permissionRevisionId
params.description: Only update the policy if the revision ID matches the ID specified

params.name: sourceAccount
params.description: The source account to limit who can invoke the function through the specified service

params.name: sourceArn
params.description: The ARN of the source to limit who can invoke the function through the specified service

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: functionName
params.description: The name of the Lambda function that the alias invokes

params.name: aliasName
params.description: The name of the alias

params.description: API version for GetAlias method

params.name: responseVariable

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: aliasName
params.description: The name of the alias to delete

params.name: apiVersionDeleteAlias
params.description: API version for DeleteAlias method

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: layerName
params.description: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the layer. For example: my-layer or arn:aws:lambda:us-east-1:123456789012:layer:my-layer

params.name: layerVersionNumber
params.description: The version number of the layer. Each layer can have multiple versions, and permissions are granted per version

params.name: layerStatementId
params.description: An identifier that distinguishes the policy from others on the same layer version. Must be unique within the layer version

params.name: layerPrincipal
params.description: An account ID, or * to grant permission to all AWS accounts. For example: 123456789012 or *

params.name: layerAction
params.description: The API action that grants access to the layer. Common values: lambda:GetLayerVersion

params.name: layerOrganizationId
params.description: The organization ID (optional). Use this to restrict access to accounts within a specific AWS organization

params.name: layerRevisionId
params.description: Only update the policy if the revision ID matches the ID that's specified. Use this to ensure that the policy hasn't changed since you last read it

params.name: apiVersionAddLayerVersionPermission
params.description: API version used for AddLayerVersionPermission method

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: The name of the variable to store the response. If not specified, the response will be stored in the message body

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Whether to replace the message body with the response from this operation

params.name: functionName
params.description: The name of the Lambda function that the alias invokes

params.name: apiVersionCreateAlias
params.description: API version for CreateAlias method

params.name: aliasName
params.description: The name of the alias

params.name: functionVersion
params.description: The function version that the alias invokes

params.name: createAliasDescription
params.description: The description of the alias

params.name: aliasAdditionalVersionWeights
params.description: The name of second alias, and the percentage of traffic that's routed to it (JSON format)

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: functionName
params.description: Name of the Lambda function

params.name: apiVersionRemovePermission
params.description: API version for RemovePermission method

params.name: permissionQualifier
params.description: Specify a version or alias to remove permission from a published version of the function

params.name: permissionStatementId
params.description: Statement ID of the permission to remove

params.name: permissionRevisionId
params.description: Only update the policy if the revision ID matches the ID specified. Use this to avoid modifying a policy that has changed since you last read it

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: functionName

params.name: aliasName
params.description: The name of the alias

params.name: apiVersionUpdateAlias
params.description: API version for UpdateAlias method

params.name: functionVersion
params.description: The function version that the alias invokes

params.name: updatedAliasDescription
params.description: The description of the alias

params.name: aliasRevisionId
params.description: Only update the alias if the revision ID matches the ID that's specified. Use this to ensure the alias hasn't changed since you last read it

params.name: updatedAliasAdditionalVersionWeights
params.description: The name of second alias, and the percentage of traffic that's routed to it (JSON format)

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: functionName
params.description: The name of the Lambda function

params.name: apiVersionGetFunctionConfiguration
params.description: API version for GetFunctionConfiguration method

params.name: qualifier
params.description: Specify a version or alias to get configuration of a specific version

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: functionName
params.description: The name of the Lambda function

params.name: functionDescription
params.description: A description of the function

params.name: apiVersionCreateFunction
params.description: API version for CreateFunction method

params.name: handler
params.description: The name of the method within your code that Lambda calls to execute your function

params.name: role
params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the function's execution role

params.name: runtime
params.description: The runtime version for the function

params.name: s3Bucket
params.description: An Amazon S3 bucket name in the same region as your function

params.name: s3Key
params.description: The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package

params.name: s3ObjectVersion
params.description: For versioned objects, the version of the deployment package object to use

params.name: zipFile
params.description: The base64-encoded contents of zip file containing your deployment package

params.name: memorySize
params.description: The amount of memory that your function has access to. Must be a multiple of 64 MB

params.name: timeout
params.description: The amount of time that Lambda allows a function to run before stopping it (max 900 seconds)

params.name: publish
params.description: Set to true to publish the first version of the function during creation

params.name: environmentVariables
params.description: Environment variable key-value pairs in JSON format

params.name: layers
params.description: A list of function layers to add to the function's execution environment

params.name: tags
params.description: A list of tags (key-value pairs) to apply to the function in JSON format

params.name: kmsKeyArn
params.description: The ARN of the KMS key used to encrypt your function's environment variables

params.name: securityGroupIds
params.description: A list of VPC security group IDs (comma-separated)

params.name: subnetIds
params.description: A list of VPC subnet IDs (comma-separated)

params.name: targetArn
params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon SQS queue or Amazon SNS topic

params.name: mode
params.description: Set to Active to sample and trace a subset of incoming requests with AWS X-Ray Supported values: Active, PassThrough

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: apiVersionGetAccountSettings
params.description: API version for GetAccountSettings method

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: apiVersionListFunctions
params.description: API version for ListFunctions method

params.name: functionVersionToBeListed
params.description: Set to ALL to include entries for all published versions of each function Supported values: ALL, $LATEST

params.name: maxItems
params.description: Number of functions to return (1-10000)

params.name: marker
params.description: Pagination token returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of results

params.name: masterRegion
params.description: For Lambda@Edge functions, the AWS Region of the master function (e.g., us-east-1 or ALL)

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: connectionName
params.description: A unique name for this Amazon Lambda connection configuration

params.name: region
params.description: The AWS region where your Lambda functions are deployed (e.g., us-east-1, eu-west-1)

params.name: accessKeyId
params.description: The AWS Access Key ID for authentication. This corresponds to the IAM user or role credentials

params.name: secretAccessKey
params.description: The AWS Secret Access Key for authentication. Keep this secure and do not expose in logs

params.name: blocking
params.description: Enable blocking invocations to Amazon Lambda.

operations.name: getAccountSettings
operations.description: Gets the settings of an account.

operations.name: createAlias
operations.description: Create an alias for a lambda function version.

operations.name: getAlias
operations.description: Returns details about a Lambda function alias.

operations.name: updateAlias
operations.description: Updates the configuration of a Lambda function alias.

operations.name: addPermission
operations.description: Grants an AWS service or another account permission to use a function.

operations.name: getFunction
operations.description: Returns information about function or function version.

operations.name: getFunctionConfiguration
operations.description: Returns the version-specific settings of a lambda function or version.

operations.name: listFunctions
operations.description: Returns a list of Lambda functions.

operations.name: removePermission
operations.description: Removes function use permission from an AWS service or another account.

operations.name: addLayerVersionPermission
operations.description: Adds permission to the resource-based policy of a version of an AWS Lambda layer.

operations.name: removeLayerVersionPermission
operations.description: Removes a statement from the permissions policy for a version of an AWS Lambda layer.
